sentences.english: Oh great, she probably thinks I'm stuck-up.
sentences.chinese: 哎呀，她很可能認爲我是個狂傲自大的傢伙。

sentences.english: But now we call the arrogant blessed.
sentences.chinese: 如今我們稱狂傲的人爲有福。

sentences.english: But they, our forefathers, became arrogant and stiff-necked, and did not obey your commands.
sentences.chinese: 但我們的列祖行事狂傲，硬着頸項不聽從你的誡命。

sentences.english: The lion's whelps have not trodden it, nor the fierce lion passed by it.
sentences.chinese: 狂傲的野獸未曾行過，猛烈的獅子也未曾經過。

sentences.english: All the arrogant and every evildoer will be stubble, and that day that is coming will set them on fire," says the LORD Almighty.
sentences.chinese: 凡狂傲的和行惡的必如碎秸。

sentences.english: Then the proud waters had gone over our soul.

definition: the eye can see nothing worthwhile all around (idiom); arrogant/condescending/supercilious
to consider everyone else beneath one (idiom); so arrogant that no-one else matters/condescending/to go about with one's nose in the air
to consider oneself unexcelled in the world/to be insufferably arrogant
